definition: to cry (of birds, animals and insects)/to make a sound/to voice (one's gratitude, grievance etc)
generic term for birds and animals/birds/to capture (old)

sentences.english: The zebra finch is a tiny Australian songbird.
sentences.chinese: 斑胸草雀是一種來自澳洲的小型鳴禽。

sentences.english: More than a catbird hates a cat.
A bird of the suborder Oscines.
sentences.chinese: 鳴禽亞目一個科裏的鳥。

sentences.english: Cold stream stripping logging pecking, songbirds Liu Xiao cord quite high.
sentences.chinese: 伐木清溪寒剝啄，鳴禽高柳曉緡蠻。

sentences.english: He combined the repertory of the birds with the repertory of the workshops.
sentences.chinese: 他把鳴禽的節目和車間的節目組合起來。

sentences.english: I think I just fell in love with Songbird.
sentences.chinese: 我想我剛纔已經深深愛上了與鳴禽。

sentences.english: The progress in the function of vocal organ in songbirds in recent years is reviewed.
sentences.chinese: 對近年在鳴禽發聲器官功能方面的研究進行綜述。

sentences.english: So they do not have any effect in songbirds.
sentences.chinese: 所以，他們沒有任何鳴禽的影響。

sentences.english: Neurogenesis occurs in some areas of the telencephalon of adult songbirds.
sentences.chinese: 成年鳴禽前腦的某些區域具有神經元的再生現象。

sentences.english: And parrots and songbirds are closer cousins than once thought.
sentences.chinese: 鸚鵡和鳴禽的親緣關係也比以前人們認爲的更近。

sentences.english: In this paper, we reviewed the processes which contribute to song learning .
sentences.chinese: 對近年來鳴禽鳴囀學習過程的研究進展進行綜述。

sentences.english: "Songbirds have a spontaneous ability to process syntactic structures in their songs," he says.
sentences.chinese: 他說，“鳴禽在歌唱時有加工句法結構的自然能力。”

definition: border fort, esp. defending narrow valley
the warbler sings and the swallow dances/prosperity abounds (idiom)
to lie in disarray/to cut across/to traverse
in large numbers/in force/lit. clouds bubbling up
Baqiao District of Xi’an 西安市[Xi1 an1 Shi4], Shaanxi
